reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the most refreshing F2P titles ever, SNOW is a Free-to-Play snowboarding/skiing game in which you can participate in solo challenges/free rides to accumulate points while enjoying the physics of the game, or you can join 11 other players on a big mountain (Siala) and simply ride around like you would on a real ski trip.

The game uses microtransactions in an acceptable way, mainly selling cosmetic items and extra events, though there is also a snomobile to be unlocked through the cash shop. The game also plays alot better with a controller, even though you can have tons of fun just playing on the keyboard. My only major gripe is the many crashed that can occur, making you lose your points, atleast in the multiplayer part of the game.

The mechanics are pretty good for a f2p and the landscape is simply amazing, from castles, to huge statues, to plain ski resorts and even a sunken village! The animation isnt the best out there, but for what it is, it's entirely acceptable. There is also a library of copyright free music that is quite relaxing, and you can modify your clothing to resemble popular skiers or snowboarders, such as Candide Thovex.


Overall, this game is certainly worth a try, especially considering its free. Bring a friend or two.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's really early to be reviewing SNOW since it is very much still ALPHA. However, my first impression is that the core game mechanic of simulating skiing is AWESOME! I have skiied a ton in real life and this feels super authentic. It is extremely exhilerating to zip past trees and take huge jumps. The tricks are really intuitive, you will figure them out just by playing around. The feeling of speed is quite visceral, especially given the fact that there is....

NO SOUND! Surprise! As of now, the game has absolutely no sound, so you will have to make whooshing sounds yourself for now.

Anyway, at this stage I'd say SNOW has a ton of potential. Ran well on my machine with minimal slowdown, and no crashes so far. If you are an avid skier this game is probably for you. If not... maybe wait on it.

Written: 6/25/2014 ---- will update as new builds get released!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is one I recommend to almost anyone.

Whether you like Skiing or not, you can still find fun in this game. Going fast down a mountain and doing flips and grabs attempting to dodge trees and rocks is adrenaline pumping and will surely make you happy. The graphics are amazing despite being an Early Access Game and there are almost no noticeable bugs. Realism is something that could be added as I enjoy skiing in real life as much as in games. Jumps seem too easy and spinning sometimes gets too fast. If you do not have enough to fund this game yet, you can check out one other game that looks similar to this called Shredsauce.

http://www.shredsauce.com/

reviewText:
Early Access Review

SNOW has a few bugs here and there, such as menu errors and starting glitches, but it's still in Early Access and has given us a promising glimpse of what the final product will look like. The game can be played for hours at a time, either to gain points and learn new tricks, or to simply view the vast amount of scenery in which the mountain offers with its beautiful graphical assets.

Overall, I'd say that this game is worth at least paying for the Starter Pack or a higher tier, as it helps to support the devs and allows you to help shape the final game!

I can't wait to show off my support with my gold helmet and skis. :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tl;dr: Game is quite buggy and barely playable as of right now, but it has major potential.

FOREWORD: **** THIS GAME IS GOING TO BE FREE TO PLAY ON FULL RELEASE ****

Graphics look nice. Cryengine does this game well. FPS drops occur occasionally, but overall it's not an issue.

Gameplay is meh. The one playable mountain as of right now looks nice, bit its hard to get down the different trails to explore the mountain more. Controls are very loose, making it hard to get where you want to be, be it jumping onto a rail or just going down a trail. Tricks are pretty basic, with some grabs and spins. Multiplayer and 'events' are being added later, and (hopefully) some of the falling through the map will stop.

Customizations is pretty good. There are a lot of options to customize your skiier, from hats and gloves to bindings and poles. You can sort by category of equipment or by brand, and a lot of major skiing companies have their equipment represented in the game.

Verdict: Wait it out. If you want to support the devs, go right ahead. Just be warned that 1) This game is going to be free-to-play on release, and 2) This game is playable, but not for very long. The gameplay is fun as a time waster, but IMO not for its current pricetag

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even though this game is still early access it is a great game. I started playing this game because a friend of me told me it was a really fun game. After I spent over an hour to complete the tutorial (I know I suck) I started playing online with my friend.

First of all I need to see that the map is very very very big. It has some really nice views. When you are just a beginner you start playing on courses on the buttom of the mountains. When you gain enough XP you are able to select a different drop point. If you do have enough XP you can start completly at the top.

Eventhough I sucked at the tutorial I did manage to stay alive for quitte a while on the server. The amount of people is limited to 12 (Not that much for such a big map) but everyone who playes it is really nice. I asked some really noob questions and the answered me like it was normal. After a few more hours playing with my friend I started to be good at it. I even managed to stay alive even longer than him :D. Skiing is not that hard anymore when you play for a little while on a server or offline.
If you do manage to stay alive you can do tricks and all kinds of cool stuff. Even though the game is early access it does not have mayor bugs. My experience was just a little glitch were I could get out of the map, nothing more.

I really do recommend this game not only for skiing but also for the nice gameplay online. People get curious if you join a server and before you know you are surrounded by other people. Really nice :)

And before I forget I heard they were busy with adding snowboarding as well :D

Early Access Review

After messing about in the game for a good while I can say that the game is enjoyable to some extent.

Free roaming and just having fun in the slopes themselves is a blast, but when you start doing events you better be prepared for a good amount of restarts due to very unpredictable behavior. Sometimes my rider started going the wrong direction or didn't start at all before i started to tap the forward button like a maniac.

When you eventually crash your character ragdolls all over the place Goat Simulator style.

If you had to put me on the spot and ask if I wanted to pay for this I'd probably pass but seeing as its free and a relatively small game, give it a go!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
- Very good Graphics! Textures are brilliant and Cry Engine makes this game look fantastic
- Immersion is great, Sounds are so lifelike and crisp and graphics come close to reality
- Smooth experience on ultra
- Multiplayer relatively smooth with a few hiccups
- Great soundtrack!

Cons:
- Levelling system with few perks, this gives the player not much motivation to score big
- Cash for ingame credits; this isn't too bad since the credits only pay for cosmetics but I think the game should have ways to unlock credits e.g level milestone 'every 25 or so levels'
- Funny but stupid ragdoll death mechanics
-Collision on some objects is odd and unrealistic (e.g hitting the side of a small rock and immediately crashing and falling.)

Overall I would reccomend this game to my friends because there is simply no other game like this on the market. Open world skiing is extremely enjoyable due to exploration, tricks and other awesome features such as unlockable areas.

You can't expect much from a game that is in Alpha, so here goes:

SNOW is a game I have had high hopes for. My favorite and first game was SSX, and ever since then I have been interested in anything to do with winter sports. I knew anything the community would find and panic over was fixed in major bug fixes, which has currently reached M4. Poppermost Productions have listened to and cared about the community that makes their games.

The game itself whilst your body may turn into a mangled mutant at the current point in time is otherwise spectacularly beutiful. With sound finally added to the game it really sounds ambiant and an escape from my place where something like snow has never existed.

Would reccomend the game. It's outstanding and will only continue getting better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Man, even though this game is in Alpha or Earlier, I believe there is extremely great potential along with very fun gameplay as it is right now.

Positives:
+very good looking game, uses CryEngine 3, soon to be CryEngine 4
+open world that as it is, turns out to be very expansive
+diverse places within the world, like ski parks, urban areas, forest slopes, mountain tops, etc.
+ambient soundtrack matches gameplay
+gameplay that hearkens back to the good old days of Tony Hawk games and Skate games

Negatives:
-As it is, more bugs that Kim K's crotch
-Some graphical issues, like snow tracks
-Ragdolls looks very unrealistic
-I believe there should be more grab tricks
-This game will be F2P when there is an official release

TL;DR; Great game to get, despite becoming F2P sooner or later along with its multiple bugs.  Poppermost Productions nailed the atmosphere, gameplay, and the wolrd to play on.

7.5-8/10: Still a work in progress, but an awesome one!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is an early access review. I have played this game on and off for about more than a year. The environment design is nice, the character design is nice as well. The controls on an Xbox 360 controller are fluid and responsive. When I started playing this game, there was no sound at all. The music and sound effects that have been added are well done. There's a persistent leveling system; I think it's used for unlocking cosmetic items and extra spawn points on the main mountain, Sialia. It's a nice open world game with plenty of opportunity for exploration. The physics are not perfect. Sometimes I stumble on a tiny bump and break my face, and sometimes I fly off a cliff doing a ridiculous stunt and land on top of somebody's vehicle and somehow get points for a perfect landing. Multiplayer was recently added, but I have not tried it yet. Good, fun game. A nice ski sim...Just what I was expecting when I bought it. It's a nice change of pace from shooting dinosaurs. The development team is responsive and continuing to put out patches and work is coming along nicely toward the version 1.0 release.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I don't normally review games, but SNOW has so much potential that i feel i have to give my feedback on it.

First of all, it's a great idea, there's no other games like this and the free-roaming skiing premise has not been done very much before.

Bearing in mind that it's completely free-to-play, i think it very good. It's still got many bugs, but as a free to play early access that only to be expected. There's a huge variety of maps, and the controls are relatively easy to get the hang of.

However, the new update has caused my character to die whenever i get dropped off, meaning only snowboarding works as an option, which is very frustrating as skiing feels more fluid at the moment. Also, the charcter model has completely disappeared (if intentional this really detracts from the game), so my skier has is merely a floating hat and gloves, with no body.

Would I recommend? Yes. its free, so why not? There are many bugs and it's certainly still in early stages, but there is huge potential here, and a finished product could be outstanding.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me just say that even though this game is in early access, im already addicted to it. I have had this game for about 1 year now and i've enjoyed every minute of it. There are so many great things about this game, for example the music is awesome and I love listening to it, the graphics are amazing for an early access game in my opinion and the main mountain is huge and there is so much to explore. I hope they add multiplayer really soon because a few of my friends have this game and im dying to play with them.

The only cons of this game that i found were that now you have to pay real money to customize your character (unlike the good old days where everything was free) and the fact that the game is still buggy (but dont let this discourage you from buying the game because its still early access and its expected).

Overall, at the moment I think this game is worth buying because the bugs make it hilarious and its so open world and nice to look at that even just going down a mountain casually is loads of fun. Dont think that this game is a waste of money because its buggy since it is in early access and thats expected (like i said before). If you arent sure about buying this game then i think you should wait for them to add more things (like multiplayer) and fix the mechanics or just wait for the game to officially release and become free to play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For anyone that likes games similar to tony hawk and skate this is for you!

It is an open world ski game that can be both relaxing and thrilling.
The open world allows for great exploration.
Game is even better with friends because the wipeouts can be especially rediculous.

Some problems with the game is to get to some locations you need to be a high rank to unlock the helicopter location, but this can be bypassed by getting to the bottom and taking the helipad.
Another problem is that the game glitches and can possibly crash the game on a bad wipe.

All in all, the game is pretty solid for the price and even without more updates I am satisfied with my purchase.

Too much snow 9/10 -IGN

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Great game, big selling potential. Unique in it's genre. Graphics are beautiful. Played skiing only with xbox one controller. A few points to make this game even better:
1. award points for great speed instead of stunts only.
2. fix skiing tutorial: it's bugged in the part where you have to do a 720. Can't continue even if you complete the 720.
3. make sure you can also break while cornering which you can also do in real life and make sure you can use the break to stand still instantly, also possible in real life.
4. add ability to make own playlist of music.
5. don't add ingame money which you need to buy with real money. Make us earn in game money by completing events.
6. make a (time trial) event for every slope.
7. make skiing over roads slow you down instead of just going the same speed as if it were snow.

I hope this feedback helps!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my review of SNOW, an Early Access game about skis.
The game is very hard to review without being picky, it's good and bad.

The button help was for Xbox one and I used an Logitech Multi Mode controller, That was not really an issue.
Pros:
-The game was fun and was very in depth,
-Even with regular physics fails the game ran perfectly smooth for such a big game,
-Very calming,
-Music was playing to fill in the lack of sound,
-Drone mode, a great way to scout out the area before you ski.

Cons:
-Multiplayer was slow and clunky,
-You have to unlock areas in the free roam meaning it wasnt really free roam,
-The controller binds were dumb, Why would you bind X to go forward and not a trigger?
-No music controls, I can't change to a different song on the fly,
-Graphics settings are low by default, I had to do alot of tweaking to make it run,
-No walk mode, I can't take in my surroundings while I am slipping around can I?

Overall, I would recommend this game but not until loads of errors are ironed out of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I heard about this game back in early 2014. I had a couple of friends who told me that I shouldn't dive head first into an ever-progressing early access ski simulator. I believe that I have around 10+ hours already, which I know doesn't seem like a lot, but that's quite a few trips down the slopes in this beautiful game. I also tested some of the boundaries, and I was impressed that there are a plethora of ways to go down the mountain in every location.

Brilliant game and I look forward to its future.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

2015: I've seen this game rise from the ashes. From being something where I was like ' This might be cool' to now, where I'm like 'This is so freaking cool'. I don't think words can do this game justice. As a snowboarder I am in love with mountains and the aspect of being able to ride across it, sadly I can't snowboard all the time. This game more/less makes up for that. With amazing graphics and beautiful sounds the team behind this has created what can only be described as a masterpeice.

2014 :This is a real snowboarding/skiing free-roam game, worthy of the title SNOW. Graphically stunning visuals make it a must play. SNOW in my opinion is up there with 1080 degrees, for the environment that is there and the amount of customisation. The developers are also very public - anwsering questions and relaying news on the latest update.

SNOW is shaping up to be a real 'must have' for skiiers or snowboarders. When the work has finally finished it will have the biggest mountain ever created to ski/board on, multiplayer, events, ski lifts, custom spawn points, replay system, halfpipe, trick parks, collectibles, and those are just the confirmed bits. All of it can be viewed here: http://snowthegame.com/2013/10/21/early-access-feedback/

I really think this is worth getting - I've spent 78 hours ingame up to the 19th of May 2014, this is most likely going to increase by a long way over the upcoming years.

10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had high hopes for SNOW, as I absolutely love anything to do with such. However, this is a very disappointing game, even for one in Alpha.

The controls are sh*te. It is near impossible to get any sense of speed. However that is a good thing, as when you do finally get some speed up, I dare you to keep it that way for more than a few seconds.

There is no sound, and barely any visuals settings, even though they are the only options you can tweak at the minute. Even if there were any visuals options, they wouldn't change jack-sh*t, as the game is fairly... Ugly. It can look very nice, with some beautifully rendered trees and rocks, however the snow and the surroundings (Mostly snow) look horrendous.

It astonishes me that something this poorly put together is on Steam. This is not an Alpha, this is someone barely putting together an engine for a game and releasing it. Give it a year and it might be playable, but for now I don't recommend picking this up even slightly.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been looking for a dedicate skiing game that gives greater emphasis on the actual exploration aspect rather than the tricked-up games on the market.  SNOW is definitely the game that meets my criteria.  Open-world exploration combined with the ability to do tricks is amazing!

I've got to hand it to the developers.  They keep updating the game, engage the community, and even created a fake Sochi slopestyle map so that we could try playing that ourselves.  Of course, Fochi 2014 isn't the best thing to ever happen to anyone but it's a solid addition to the game and shows that they listen to users.

I can't wait for the further development of this game and it's DEFINITELY worth the money.

This game is still a bit buggy, but honestly is the most promising skiing simulator I've played. The thrill you get from hitting cliffs in first person is astounding, top that off with the park, and the secret castle and you have a world of adventure. It's an incredible experience if you're an avid skier. It makes up for those days when you can't make it to the resort. I can't wait to see what this game has in store, especially multiplayer and new mountains.

If you like the serenity of skiing, this game is for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As of 28/12/2013:

The Good: A one of a kind open world ski game with a great idea at it's core.
The Bad: Most Menu's are inaccessible, missing a lot of features including multiplayer and physics are questionable.
The Ugly: Certain Texture's will not load, resolutions are buggy and the game crashes when you try to change camera angle.
The Downright Ridiculous: THERE IS NO SOUND AT ALL.

Overall, if skiing is your thing, this is worth the purchase to support the developers. Whilst I'm sure this game will improve over time, the label 'Early Access Game' is there for a reason.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is exactly what Early Access is supposed to be!
First of all, the game is, lacking features such as snowboards, and sound, but that's okay. It's early access, so you know what to expect.

Second, this is going to be a F2P game, and although many people argue that paying now for a F2P game is not smart, I have to disagree there. With buying, you're making sure that it doesn't need to be milked out as much as Pay2Win games. And, developers need to eat as well.

Having said that, the game is actually quite enjoyable. I loved the first person camera mode, and I can only imagine how great it'll be when I buy an Oculus Rift (Which it supports).
In this state, all you can do is set up your graphics settings, and ski on this huge-♥♥♥ mountain. It is bigger than expected. If you buy any of the 2 tiers, you can access Multiplayer right away, if you choose for the cheapest tier, you'll have to wait a little longer. But looking on their websites, and the upcoming features, made me excited. I could only dream that such a small team could accomplish so many already.
voteText: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One word somes up an Early Access title like this one, WOW. (haha wow, like the doge hahahahaahha stfu). I'm going to be 100% honest and say I really don't know where to begin. Seriously, I don't know why this game is as much as fun as it is. The physics still need work, they're are quite a bit of glitches and animations still need some work. But despite everything I can find sloppy or slack within in this game it's still just so amazingly fun. The graphics are immersive to say the least and the sound design is just, ah, pristine. There really isn't much to be said. There is endless fun and potential within this game and its worth every penny. In my case, 50 pennys, and by pennys I mean dollars because I have no problem with dropping that amount of money on such an amazing game and its amazing customization, the team at Poppermost deserve it. Thank you Poppermost for making a great game to complment my saturday night pizza.

Score: 9/10

Pros:
=>Amazing Sound
=>In depth customization
=>Well priced micro transactions (IMO)
=>Endless fun
=>Easy controls for controllers
=>Dat afterbang though

Cons:
=>Bugs and glitches
=>Unresponsive menu
=>Mother ♥♥♥♥ing rocks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am not that good at writing reviews but here goes:

SNOW, is an absolute delight. I was more than happy tp buy the founders pack knowing that the money would hopefully be going to the developers of such and amazing game.
The beauty of it all is breath taking. If you haven't been ontop of a Mountain as the Sun rises or sets this is pretty damn close.
Yes this may be early alpha but it still handles amazingly. No major bugs that causes you to rip your hair out, just funny little ones such and not wiping out after htting and rock and just standing there like I don't give a F***".
The controls are easy once you learn them and you can happily explore all over the mountain
date: and it isn't even finished yet!\nI urge you to buy this game

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSNOW is still in alpha, and therefore can hardly be judged as a final product, but as it is now, it is not worth buying. All there is to do is free roam the mountain with no objective, and really, nothing is of interest other than the few trick courses. It gets really repetitive just seeing trees and rocks over and over again. Furthermore, the game has no audio, which will just further add to the monotony. You might be able to extend the experience by messing around with the gravity in the game files, but really, as it is in alpha, this game only has about three hours of enjoyable content at most. Hopefully future updates will make the game an enjoyable experience, which it does have the potential to become, but just don't buy it in alpha. Pass judgement when there is more to the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Please tell us Early Acess-ers get cool stuff once the F2P version comes out...
Other than that the game is good for an alpha, just lemme tell you what you are getting into.
1. No sound, like at all. They plan to add sound and music in the future but in the meantime you're gonna have to play your own tunes.
2. It's not as easy to pick up and play as the trailer makes it out to be. The controls take time and patience.
3. Only 1 level/mountain right now. They obviously plan to add more in the future.
4. The graphics are achieved by cryengine and the game is decently optimised but has very little options for visuals.
That's about it, take t^h^o^s^e facts and do with your money what you will.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been looking for a dedicate skiing game that gives greater emphasis on the actual exploration aspect rather than the tricked-up games on the market.  SNOW is definitely the game that meets my criteria.  Open-world exploration combined with the ability to do tricks is amazing!

I've got to hand it to the developers.  They keep updating the game, engage the community, and even created a fake Sochi slopestyle map so that we could try playing that ourselves.  Of course, Fochi 2014 isn't the best thing to ever happen to anyone but it's a solid addition to the game and shows that they listen to users.

I can't wait for the further development of this game and it's DEFINITELY worth the money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

a Must-Play  for anyone who likes skiing/wintersports.

I don't really write reviews but since this game is still being worked on I will use this as a place to provide valuable feedback to the developer.

1. Time Trial mode gives you three medals. It does not tell you in what time you must finish to obtain these medals. I'm almost certain just finishing the course without any collision awards a Bronze - but silver and gold need additional information.
2. I am unable to turn off the music in the game. I turned it all the way down in the options yet the music is still playing. Annnnnoying.
3. Game crashes within an hour or so into me playing(sometimes in as little as 5 minutes. Says due to some sort of graphical error. CryEngine Error.DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_HUNG  --  Some times I can reopen the game and other times-Steam will say I still have the application ALREADY RUNNING in the background (When that is not the case). Resulting in me having to reboot my machine to start the game again.
4. Glad to see Steam Achievements added - However they are all hidden so you don't even know what to do to unlock them. Annnnnoying.
5. Leaderboards are broken---please make them actually work correctly.
6. ZERO CUSTOMIZATION of your rider. All the gear is PURCHASEABLE only. NEED BOTH FREE AND PAID CONTENT... DONT BE STUPID.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just received my beta key today from SNOW after waiting a while. This game is incredible, but noticably unfinished, but that's ok. This game, being in beta, obviously has a lot of quirks that need to be ironed out, yet in the state its in, is still an interesting and fun game. I'll try to update this review as I play some more, and as updates come in, but as a first impression, here's what I have:
- The vastness of the mountain is incredible: So far I've been able to access one mountain with 4 sides"
date: with their own parks and trails. The size and structure of the mountain is very large
recommended: and if and when more are implemented
hoursPlayed: will give this game more than enough variety.\n- The character customization is really cool: You have a large selection of real life gear
voteText: from head to toe. Each piece costs credits
helpfulPercent: which you can buy with real money
votesHelpful: but is really cool nonetheless. Having microtransactions for cosmetic items is a great way to generate revenue in a free to play game.\n- The tricks are cool
votesTotal: but there are quirks: I'm still learning how to maneuver well
votesFunny: but the tricks are generally well done. Airs are decently well timed
commentsCount: although you do pretty much land anything as long as you're not upside down. The rail slides are pretty broken to be honest
column16: there's no real feedback that you've done a railslide
column17: and hopping on to rails isn't exactly satisfying.\n\nOverall
column18: the game is alot of fun in its current state and I'm super excited to see how it's going to look once all the quirks are ironed out."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Right now: finicky controls take a bit to get used to, but it's really nice once you get the hang of things.  Item store offers ways ingame to earn currency, and all items are cosmetic right now.  Currently, only the skiing module is released.

Very average looking, with good music (though it gets repetitive, there aren't enough tracks).

It's a breath of fresh air for games, especially sports games, IMO, and easily worth $10 right now.  Looking foward to the snowboarding module!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Though I haven't played this game too much, I think I am capable of writing a solid review since there isn't too much in the game yet.  To start, I think this game is a very good start to what could potentially turn into the best free game on steam.  I will now do a pros and cons list.

Pros:
-graphics are very good for early stage
-Rewind mechanic lets you fix mistakes easily if you want to hit that jump perfectly
-though there are microtransactions, they are limited to asthetic only, and if this business model holds true I will be very happy
-very interesting and fun map design (Main mountainous map)
-Good frame rate/no frame dropping even at high speed (I am on an alienware 13 laptop)


Cons:
-in air controls can sometime feel clunky
-needs a camera control feature so you can look around the enivironment
-skiier is sometimes stuck in revers, and is hard to turn around
-multiplayer needs more way to interact with other players

Conclusion:
If you are looking for a skiing game than you should be extremely excited for this one to release in full.  It has the chance to become a fantastic game.  What the devs need to work on is the controls and multiplayer, but it is understandable that these wouldn't be perfect as the game is clearly still in early development.  I would highly recommend this game to most people, especially those in the Northeast, like me, who have had no snow and need their skiing itch to be statisfied.  So far this game has helped me to keep my mind off the dissapointing lack of snow this winter.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A game with ALOT of potential.
Stuff that it desperately needs:

-dynamic snow

-dynamic weather

-skiis (don't know how to pronounce it) NEED to be going through the snow in deep snow. They can't just float on white textures.

-An after-ski area where people can enjoy unique minigames

-make interactions with players in multiplayer (races, challenges)

-LIFTS. In multiplayer the devs  should make an option (when you enter the ski lift) to either
1. Wait for other players to fill the lift seats. When in the lift the players should be able to talk with each other
OR 2. just ride alone

-HUGE ONE. Gameplay. Improve how the game feels. It is really important because I wanted to explore the different areas but the skiing looks stiff and the gameplay is rather boring.

-This game lacks in animations. The animations are also super important because if you pull of a sick trick it has to look really badass. Not some locked animation and the model just rotates. Look at the game SSX and learn from that (they really nailed the gameplay and badassnes in that one).

So. For now just give it try and see for yourself if you are into it or not. I am really hoping this to be a big one.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Excuse me people, but cause you can't add $15 to the game and get your character better looki' it DOES NOT mean AT ALL that the game sucks. You all basterds, look at the game!! The developers are awesome and they update it a lot, I bought the game before 2 days or so, and the Multiplayer Servers are VERY active! at least 3 players everyday in a server. (Now I know 3 players isn't a lot but this game is a Beta + people don't buy it just CAUSE the character lookin'..) Anyway to the point:

Pros:
*Great Lookin' Menu - Really nice to the eyes!
*Character Lookin' - Listen, You can just add $15 and you will have your dream character, + don't listen to people that CRY over character lookin'... C'mon are you a baby?! :/
* Tricks - There are A LOT of tricks in the game, tricks to the GROUND and in to the AIR.
*Free Roam - The Free Roam is so beautiful, it really is I recommend you to check it out! There isn't only 1 mountain there are more + there are some parks and events. (as well challenges).
*Multiplayer - As I said, not too much to say cause the multiplayer has all I said now ;) but yeah it is really nice that there is multiplayer, you can have some new friends do some tricks together, chill out and have some fun!
*Controls - You can choose what to play with, Keyboard / Controler, I think it is really nice!

P.S Awesome game but! For all the people who think this game is ♥♥♥♥ and they judge it cause of the character lookin' are pretty much..♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s you stop the game improving it self just CAUSE you CRY about character lookin'...Go *** ok?

Cons:

*Physics - The physics are a bit clunky when you Crash but overall when you just play without crashing they are good.
*Controls* - Not really a con :/ I just want to say you can't yet change the controls on PC, but I don't know what about Controler though, But as I said it really isn't a con it's just you can't change them yet!

Overall!
5 Pros.
2 Cons.

Opinion about the game:

Really it is my opinion but I really hope you will try it out guys, seriously you are not homless it is only $10 bucks! c'mon show some help for the Updating Developers" :) they really do update a lot which is a Pro isn't it? oh wait!

*6 Pros.
*2 Cons.

So I hope I made it a little more sharper for you! Please buy the game and help it improve

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... This is one of the most legit ski games I have played. I am a snowboarder in person, but that doesnt take anything away from my gameplay experience. One of the main reasons I love this game so much is how active the developers are. They dont F*ck around, they respond to the community, and they seem to add enough content with every update to keep me interested (unlike dayz).

Pros
Great physics (slightly glitchy at times, but its early access)
Multiplayer
Beautiful map
Amazing jumps, and many many jumps you have yet to find

Cons
They have not added snowboarding :(
The game is called SNOW" but it seems only ski based
The trails your skiis leave are a little bit glitchy

Overall
date: great game and you should definately buy it to support the developers.\n"
hoursPlayed: true
helpfulPercent: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just received my beta key today from SNOW after waiting a while. This game is incredible, but noticably unfinished, but that's ok. This game, being in beta, obviously has a lot of quirks that need to be ironed out, yet in the state its in, is still an interesting and fun game. I'll try to update this review as I play some more, and as updates come in, but as a first impression, here's what I have:
- The vastness of the mountain is incredible: So far I've been able to access one mountain with 4 sides"
date: with their own parks and trails. The size and structure of the mountain is very large
recommended: and if and when more are implemented
hoursPlayed: will give this game more than enough variety.\n- The character customization is really cool: You have a large selection of real life gear
voteText: from head to toe. Each piece costs credits
helpfulPercent: which you can buy with real money
votesHelpful: but is really cool nonetheless. Having microtransactions for cosmetic items is a great way to generate revenue in a free to play game.\n- The tricks are cool
votesTotal: but there are quirks: I'm still learning how to maneuver well
votesFunny: but the tricks are generally well done. Airs are decently well timed
commentsCount: although you do pretty much land anything as long as you're not upside down. The rail slides are pretty broken to be honest
column16: there's no real feedback that you've done a railslide
column17: and hopping on to rails isn't exactly satisfying.\n\nOverall
column18: the game is alot of fun in its current state and I'm super excited to see how it's going to look once all the quirks are ironed out."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, when I first started playing. And I haven't been playing for long. I just saw it for it's silly ragdolls. But as I played, I saw something more beautiful. As I sped down slopes and looked around at the landscape. I was left in shock to it's beauty. I eventually learnt how to pull of amazing flips and stunts! I would dash down hills, mountains, forests, cliff faces. And do some wacky things. This game feels awesome, everyone should give it a try.

Though this game isn't perfect. Our lovely developers thought it would be a good idea to put a high price on cosmetics! I would like to customize my character to as an acurate version of me in my snow gear, as possible! But Because I don't want to blow off 20 dollars, No thankyou! It would be much better if we got credits as we leveled up! Or if every run we did, we would get points for it! I get you guys need money, but this isn't a good way to do it! Also, you guys have us to buy events... And the only reason anyone would buy an event is because the item you get for getting Gold on it. I'm pretty sure you can buy the same item for less... In most cases.


That was the only complaints I had. 'Tis a fun game. Try it some time! Just don't buy stuff until they make it reasonable...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was bored, found a game, played it, enjoyed it.
My playtime doesn't really matter but this game does remind me of Skate 3, except that it has no Map borderlines, and its set in snow. I wouldn't be surprised if the devs choose to go for a Skating Genre or Surfing genre on the next game because they successfully did it on this one. This is definitely a cool game for an Early Access and I would love to see more from the Devs.

There is one thing that needs to be fixed in the game, which is the CURSOR. It camouflages within the Menu sometimes. Maybe change it to a Blue or Cyan

Apart from the Windows 10 looking menu, and using Cry Engine it really does succeed in reaching the goal of being a Snow-sport game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's in Alpha so it'S FULL of bugs. (Some of them hilarious tho lol go see ''We Broke Snow'' on Youtube)

The game crash often and sometimes the multiplayer stops working so you have to restart the game.
Same thing for the menu sometimes you press start and nothing happens so you are stuck if you fall you need to kill the process and restart the whole game.
BUT like i said it's alpha so i expect those kind of game breaking bugs.
The servers NEED to have more than 12 people at LEAST 24 players per servers. On such a big mountain it's not enough players at the same time.

Reaally fun and relaxing.
The events are great. Music is great. Graphics are amazing.... and it's free so yeah you should absolutely play this.

This game needs snowboards too but i'm sure it's on the way.
Better played with a controller. Hard to play on keyboard.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here is a game that needed to be made, as there is a massive gap in the market for games like SNOW. A beautiful snow covered mountain is the setting as you and your skiis glide down steep slopes and dodge through wintery forests. SNOW is a beautiful game.

However, it is in alpha/beta stage and its all very basic at the moment, you get the distinct feeling that they are struggling to update this game in time for release, it has its fair share of bugs and glitches but on top of all that is a distinctly beautiful experience with a great sound track and a game that is unrivaled in what it sets out to do. It is a Skiing game that captures the beauty and speed of skiing, and it is the best on any console right now.

Hopefully the developers will cross the finish line with a game that we can all be proud to have played, but until then, its a waiting game.


8.5/10
Pro's -
* Has the potential to be the best skiing game ever
* Amazing mountain sandbox
* Graphics
* Has multiplayer
Cons-
*They havent made it yet.
* gltichy and buggy (including the physics)
* Future is uncertain
* Multiplayer is laggy at the moment (devs have stated this should improve with server improvement)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Haven't felt this kind of atmosphere in a while. I love it, but at the same time I see so much potential wasted. The controls are very odd and frustrating, and FPS drops are everywhere.

The UI is phenomenal, the music is outstanding. The atmosphere is what keeps me craving more. I want this game to have a good release so badly, but I don't really see that happening..

I'd also love to see a lodge where you can walk around without your gear. Also, why aren't there snowboarding or any other winter sports?

Would I recommend this? Well, yes. For the people with beefy computers, go for it. You've got nothing to loose since it's free. If you want a finished product, I'd hold off until release.. if it ever gets released.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly a really good game, the online is a bit laggy but the single player is silky smooth.
Graphics: 7/10 (could be because it's in alpha. Some graphics aren't updated yet. NPC viewers of events look like they're pulled from southpark, The trees look terrible and 2D, The snow, tracks, ramps, and lighting is really good looking)
Fun: 9/10 (Really fun and there are lots of challenges and events to do, a lot to keep you busy)
Soundtrack 10/10 (speaks for its self)
Controls: 8/10 (I've been playing with a controller, grabbing different parts of your skis can be hard while holding A getting ready to jump, But otherwise tricks and combos are fun and easy to learn.)
Online: 5/10 (Was very laggy for me, even connecting to the lowest ping server...50ping... was incrdibly choppy, other players don't seem to be doing anything)
All together my honest opinion would be a solid 8/10 (MY OPINION) I would recommend this game as a nice casual game to play or for people who are into sking
TLDR
Very fun, looks nice, controls can be steep to learn. Once you get the hang it's a blast.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Excuse me people, but cause you can't add $15 to the game and get your character better looki' it DOES NOT mean AT ALL that the game sucks. You all basterds, look at the game!! The developers are awesome and they update it a lot, I bought the game before 2 days or so, and the Multiplayer Servers are VERY active! at least 3 players everyday in a server. (Now I know 3 players isn't a lot but this game is a Beta + people don't buy it just CAUSE the character lookin'..) Anyway to the point:

Pros:
*Great Lookin' Menu - Really nice to the eyes!
*Character Lookin' - Listen, You can just add $15 and you will have your dream character, + don't listen to people that CRY over character lookin'... C'mon are you a baby?! :/
* Tricks - There are A LOT of tricks in the game, tricks to the GROUND and in to the AIR.
*Free Roam - The Free Roam is so beautiful, it really is I recommend you to check it out! There isn't only 1 mountain there are more + there are some parks and events. (as well challenges).
*Multiplayer - As I said, not too much to say cause the multiplayer has all I said now ;) but yeah it is really nice that there is multiplayer, you can have some new friends do some tricks together, chill out and have some fun!
*Controls - You can choose what to play with, Keyboard / Controler, I think it is really nice!

P.S Awesome game but! For all the people who think this game is ♥♥♥♥ and they judge it cause of the character lookin' are pretty much..♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s you stop the game improving it self just CAUSE you CRY about character lookin'...Go *** ok?

Cons:

*Physics - The physics are a bit clunky when you Crash but overall when you just play without crashing they are good.
*Controls* - Not really a con :/ I just want to say you can't yet change the controls on PC, but I don't know what about Controler though, But as I said it really isn't a con it's just you can't change them yet!

Overall!
5 Pros.
2 Cons.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: this game is great and i highly recommend playing with a console controller for the best experience, however, the keyboard controls are also very good in my opinion.

multiplayer has issues with being able to land huge jumps where you just instantly crash as opposed to single player where jumping huge land sites actually allows fluid landing, so would recommend sticking with single player right now
the other issue with multiplayer is that the lag adds a very noticable difference in sensitivity over your control, making your SNOW experience feel somewhat clunky when maneuvering.

some bugs are really frustrating but most of the time you're enjoying yourself, i.e for example you might land perfectly but in some situations your skiis will get stuck under the snow, causing you to crash

other times you will hit trees at full force and not die, kind of detracting from the realism the game is trying to impose
i've noticed most bugs have been sorted out by the devs within a few days, especially if a new update has caused some issues and they definitely seem to be active

it's very easily the best SNOW related game out, especially considering the fact that it's free

super excited for snowboards and snowmobiles as well as the ability to change the terrain anywhere!
keep an eye on this one :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

APRIL UPDATE
-Snowboarding and snowmobiles on the way at the end of this month!
(i know this isnt a real update to a review, that will come when they are actually implemented)

P.S. Lulz @ skiholes who didnt like my review because of snowboard comments


~OPEN BETA UPDATE~

After a rough start the devs pumped out multiple hotfixes within a day and have the game up and running. definately worth checking out.

also remember to harass the devs to add snowboarding like they said they were going to.




~WRITTEN DURING CLOSED BETA~

In a world where realistic extreme sports games are no more, especially on PC, SNOW is a light in the darkness. Thats not to say its without its problems though.

Pros
-Physics. I've worked as a liftie in Vt and can say the feel of being on snow/rails/boxes is all solid and in line with really cruising down a mountain
-Optional First Person Mode. Why havent more extreme sports games done first person? there arent words to describe hitting a double cork 1080 in first person.
-Open Mountain. you literally have accesss to the ENTIRE mountain. want trails? they are there. want a park? there are a few. want backcountry, go nuts.
-Ragdoll Bails. While these arent the most realistic animations in the world, they will leave you cringing and laughing after you smash a rock at speed

Cons
-No Snowboarding. This is a big one for me. when this game was on kickstarter the devs were promising snowboarding was going to be added as soon as the basics of skiing were in. this has not happened and there has been no news to hint that it is still planned. it leaves the mountains feeling like those douchey ski only resorts. wheres the boarder love?
-rough multiplayer. the devs announced that they will be upgrading thier servers when the game goes to open beta. this is very much needed as a random lag spike can kill an amazing run down the mountain or ruin a nice freeroam follow the leader session
-microtransactions. there are a lot of them. essentially everything to customize your rider costs real money (not much compared to some other games though) there also appears to be some events" that you buy into with real money (havent tried these so i cant speak to much on them)
-wierd snow behavior. i know i know
date: its a beta. but sometimes snow will magically leave a trail in the air behind you when you jump
recommended: and it stays that way even on your next run down the mountain
hoursPlayed:
this isnt a major issue but can cause issues lining up jumps and grinds in the parks.

Overall: is SNOW worth it?
if you have been craving some realistic extreme sports or if you are a mountain lifer then this game is definately for you. if you like exploring in a relaxing setting this game is probably for you. if you want somethinglike tony hawks pro skater on skis
voteText: you should stay far far away."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I understand that snow is now a Free To Play Beta, and that the game isn't expected to be perfect. I will just be saying how things are (for me and a lot of other people, not everyone).

First off, SNOW is a lot of fun, singleplayer and (sometimes) multiplayer are great and the game has a lot of potential and it would be an amazing game if only...

It worked, which it kinda doesn't at the moment.

The game is constantly crashing (for me and a couple of others who tried out the game).

Multiplayer is a mess.All the servers are mostly full because of the 12 players cap and they will always display that they have over 300+ ping when they actually don't. When hovering over someone's name in the spawnmenu the game will put a camera on them like you're spectating them. If you scroll through the players (unintetionally) the camera will glitch out and it might crash your game because the FPS drops to 0-2. Sometimes when you spawn, there will be random invisible walls right infront of you completely blocking your movement and it takes away all your points if you jump because of 'bad landing'. Sometimes the walls are placed a bit infront of you so after you gained some speed you instantly crash because of the god damn wall. Sometimes when other players spawn on you, it will make you crash instantly.

These are the multiplayer problems I'm having, some might have the same, some might not.

Singleplayer/EventsSingleplayer is a lot better than multiplayer in terms of the game working, but it gets easily boring skiing around by yourself. So you either jump into Multiplayer, or you go do some Events! (Since leveling up gives you no credits at all and you can unlock a yellow outfit through the events that are free. Now I warn you, if you haven't played the game or Events, this will frustrate the living **** out of you. Some Events are fairly easy, and some will make you rip your hair out. I'm not going to get into a lot of detail about this, but it kinda sucks that the events don't give you credits so you can buy your own gear instead of a boring yellow outfit.

With all that said, the game is still worth downloading since it's free and it is fun, when it works.

Like I said, I know this is a free to play beta and you can't expect too much from it just yet. I know the game will improve and I am definitely looking forwards to it.
That's all I'm going to write for now..

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nit's a fun game, with lots of potential but it's clearly lacking at the moment. i was expecting some sort of racing game but it wasn't... basically you just ski around with no apparent goal. it's fun, cusual, good for killing time but i highly doubt i'd be able to play this for a very long time. there are way too few tricks; a mix of grab and spin. zero customization, you can't even choose your sex. clothes are all from real money store, which is a big let down. save point are hard to find, score (or exp) is only obtainable from doing jump & trick which is stupid. multiplayer is still locked... no idea what it will look like. and the effect of speed is barely there. on the other side, the open world aspect is really interesting (even though most of the drop point are still locked) you can go anywhere on the mountain, jump anywhere... i wish project powder still existed, because i'd be playing that instead!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I absolutely love this game and can't wait for all the new features, especially snowboarding as a boarder myself. Graphics are brilliant and the character animations are smooth and fluid, you can tell most of the devs are skiers themselves. At the moment only one side of on mountain is available to ski, but even this was enough to keep me entertained for hours, there's hundreds of different paths to choose and jumps placed at regular intervals.

Some things I would like added are working ski lifts or helicopter drops, AI skiers on the slopes too, and the park to be extended a bit more. Maybe add a proper winter olympics style ski jump somewhere too.

And to all the people complaining about a lack of features, the big blue bar saying EARLY ACCESS might have given you a clue as to what you are paying for - do your research before you click buy!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game should not be on Steam at all! It is broken and unplayable. Yes, you can say the game is in it's early alpha stages and I should expect bugs and general annoying gameplay. But when the developers announced that the game would be ready by Febuary of this year back in October of last and it isn't, well that just shows how little care they have for the game.

I bought into the this game as the original discription that was on Steam at the first release of this half arsed early access, was snowboarding. At first they never pointed out that the snowboarding would be implimented later on in the game's life. All that was stated in the original discription is that the game was in early alpha and that it had some issues.

I am sick and tired of developers throwing their game onto Steam as an early access". It is terrible marketing and has already made me want to not play the game when it is fully released. If that ever happens! I shall remind you

Early Access Review

The game is completely broken on linux. Until that's fixed, this review stays a thumbs down.

On windows, i was able to launch and start the tutorials, but the game would not recognize when I did a basic grab on the jump tutorials. A 360 was recognized just fine, but grabbing ANY side of the snowboard did not register and was sent back to the start roughly 10 times before i quit and deleted the game. (this is also why i have only 0.2 hours as of writing this)

Many issues to address as this early access game improves.
If this had a star rating, i'd give it a 3/5 and a star can be added each for: Making the linux client work; refining the tutorials so that you can actually pass them.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

10/10 !!
This is definitely the best skiing game I've ever played, and it still is. The recently implemented new mechanics are not as good as they could be, but the developers already told us fixes are coming with the 0.5.1 patch.
Well... After the closed beta update, 0.5.0, people are whining a lot about the new changes. Especially because they can't get their cosmetic items (for free!), which does absolutely nothing, besides making you look a little unique. You can still ride all the mountains, try out all the events, and you're certainly not limited by any micro-transactions gameplay-wise. You can use all the grabs, ride just as fast, and compete in just as many events as you want to - FOR FREE!

This is what I would like to see in EVERY Free-to-Play game. Where you ONLY have to (optionally) pay for cosmetic items. Here in SNOW, as it is in 0.5.0, you can't pay to get BETTER. You can only look slightly 'cooler'.

On a whole 'nother note, here's a few quotes by a few developers from Poppermost, the company who makes the game SNOW, regarding the new shop and the new mechanics:
1. Asurao: We have no plans to charge you for new levels/mountains. We want everyone to be able to ride together whether they've spent money or not. This is core to the game." and "There will be many ways to earn credits in the future".
(>>Source<<)

2. Rubadubdub!: "I can ensure you that there will be other ways of getting new gear in the future
date: so you'll still be able to get pretty good gear just like in TF2
recommended:
CS: GO etc."
(>>Source<<)

3. Asurao: "As we continue working towards Open Beta (0.6.0) we will be adding player progression (a leveling system) so that you can earn items without having to buy them"
>>Source<<

4. Asurao: "I agree that the break-turn isn't working as intended and overall speed management feels very sporadic. We're looking into this and will make improvements in future updates."
(>>Source<<)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has connected to me on a emotional level.

When I first puchased this around two months ago, it was an alright game, third-person, nice looking and had some nice controls. Since the Closed-Beta update, this has become one of the most amazing games I have ever played.

The main thing they have added is a first person camera, which adds so much immersion it is crazy. The controls are now a lot more smoother, simple, but very diverse and allow you to carve it up very realistically.

One of the main problems I encounter frequently is texture pop-in and missing textures. There is nothing worse than dropping in and having a rock appear 3 metres from you. These are teething issues that are sure to be fixed down the line. Another personal issue is the added store feature, but since this game will be free to play at full release it is something I can live with, hopefully the Alpha and Beta testers get a lil extra ;).


In conclusion if you have any interest in skiing whatsoever you should absoluteley buy this game to support the continued development. If you aren't, or you don't want to deal with Beta bugs, hold out for the F2P full release :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Why did I pay for this heaping sack of fermented poop?

First off, this is a paid for F2P game. . . all you're actually getting is some attrocious looking cosmetic stuff.  Sadly, when i bought this (Febuary 2014) I must have been tired and not have realized this.  If it had been in the genre of F2P (Like it should have) then I never would have paid a penny.  I actually beg the people reading this to wait until it's fully F2P before deciding to give them money.  It's bad. . . really bad.  You'd have more fun with Bad Rats.

Now on to the game play.

When I went to customize my character, all the logos and designs were blurred out and looked horrid.

So I got character set up in his blurry clothes and went to play.  It stuck on the loading screen for a few minutes and CRASH.  No error message was given. The game was closed and here was my desktop.  So I loaded it to give it another try.  Third person view seemed okay.  I did a backflip in midair and i did a grind on something.  Nothing impressive. I've seen better in the original tony hawk pro skater.  Fooled around a bit and that seemed like all i could figure out how to do other than crash and make my head flop around in a goofy fashion.

After the first shot, I decided to try another track.  I don't know what I did, but I suddenly found myself in 1st person view.  This seemed kinda badass and actually easier to see what i was doing.  I actually kind of liked this. Almost had fun for a few minutes, then it wore thin and i closed it.

Maybe in ANOTHER year or two they might have this up to the point of being playable. . . but not yet.  Seriously - save your money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not going to complain about the micro transactions as the consensus amongst gamers should be quite clear for everyone already (yes devs, hint hint, we who had hopes in you paid for this already). SNOW has great potential but it crashes every freaking five minutes or so at the very moment. At its current state SNOW is more unstable than ever and I've been playing this every now and then for almost two years now. I would've expected more of the devs. I really do not write reviews here, but the approximately ten crashes within the last half an hour was the last straw for me. Also the sudden drops in frame rate are a common issue and I do have more than sufficient gear to play this for the freaking five minutes at the time.

Dear devs, could you please make it work as I don't want to lose my hope on this.

Rant over.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIts not that I don't like this game, I do. It's a fun lil snowboarding game that almost reminds me of the SSX and Amped: Freestyle that I played back when I did the console thing. It's just there's a lotta bugs, the wipeouts are hilariouslyyyy bad (which might even convince some to play), the business model is a lil.... restrictive (though i understand they gotta make money to continue production). Funny the first time, frustrating the 20th.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing, it is simply fantastic, and beautiful. It gives me a vibe of SSX and Skiing itself. The Physics in the game are decent, and the VR is a cool feature.

This is where I hate this game, and will cause me to give it a negative review.

Paying for Credits.
Now people will actaully try to defend this, and say it isn't necessary, but this is something that everyone in the game wants to achieve, allow people to buy, and EARN credits. I know you want money, but you still still have people buying credits about as much, because most people who have money to burn, would buy credits anyway, and are mostlikely the only ones in the game buying credits.

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Physics.
I understand that sometimes landing on a slop wrong will get you wiped out, but this is stupid. People spawn inside of me, and get me killed on a good run, that is idiotic. Also landing perfectly on the ground at a fast speed will also get me killed, which is also stupid.

Lack of content.
Do NOT compare this to skate, skate had all these things that this game doesnt have, good physics, customization without paying for it, and skate had alot more stuff we could do. This game just has a mountain that you can go down a few trails and stuff at high speeds which is fun and all, but me and my friends want competitions, allow us to make lobbys and battle eachother in game modes such as Max Speed, or Big air, or even the most simple one. Racing.


Either way, the game is beautiful, but lacks on those 3 topics, and it will end up killing it in the end. I hope the developer reads this review, which they mostlikely wont and will disreguard my comment, just as all developers do, and it will kill this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing, it is simply fantastic, and beautiful. It gives me a vibe of SSX and Skiing itself. The Physics in the game are decent, and the VR is a cool feature.

This is where I hate this game, and will cause me to give it a negative review.

Paying for Credits.
Now people will actaully try to defend this, and say it isn't necessary, but this is something that everyone in the game wants to achieve, allow people to buy, and EARN credits. I know you want money, but you still still have people buying credits about as much, because most people who have money to burn, would buy credits anyway, and are mostlikely the only ones in the game buying credits.

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Physics.
I understand that sometimes landing on a slop wrong will get you wiped out, but this is stupid. People spawn inside of me, and get me killed on a good run, that is idiotic. Also landing perfectly on the ground at a fast speed will also get me killed, which is also stupid.

Lack of content.
Do NOT compare this to skate, skate had all these things that this game doesnt have, good physics, customization without paying for it, and skate had alot more stuff we could do. This game just has a mountain that you can go down a few trails and stuff at high speeds which is fun and all, but me and my friends want competitions, allow us to make lobbys and battle eachother in game modes such as Max Speed, or Big air, or even the most simple one. Racing.


Either way, the game is beautiful, but lacks on those 3 topics, and it will end up killing it in the end. I hope the developer reads this review, which they mostlikely wont and will disreguard my comment, just as all developers do, and it will kill this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-review subject to change as the game does-


Pre review TL;DR:A very laggy early access skiing game, i would love it if it ran better on lower end graphics cards but sadly it does not. if you have better specs than i do then go ahead and try the game out.


Pros:+Free to play

+Lovely menu music and gui, rather soothing

+I love exploration so if it had better fps i would love freeroaming everywhere

+Useful rewind mechanic


Cons:-Controls are sluggish

-Even the main menu somehow lags, how can you only get 15 fps on a main menu? (the loading screen for the maps gets 45 more fps too)

-Difficult tutorial ending

-Good old glitches, like character freezing up and unable to move unless you rewind time

-No offline mode


More specific/personal issues--hitbox for settings menu arrows is far too small

-performing a 720 flip+advanced grab is incredibly difficult, i know what to do but its hard to do it and this is just the tutorial level (maybe im missing something)

-when messing with res moving my proper mouse to the right causes the ingame mouse to go a % farther than my proper mouse, so its disconnecting



I'd like to mention my system is an amd 8 core + gt 610
Game played with mouse and keyboard, controls and default

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHonestly thought the game was not what it was worked up to be upon getting it on the steam sale. It is early access but I gave into the extra tester pack, I thought I should just give in there, no point in playing anymore. I had troubles with controls, and got stuck several times, but I prevailed and gave it a few more hours. I was sincerely surprised at how amazing it was after figuring out the controls and getting onto the actual mountain. The views are wonderful, theres tons of small easter eggs and a book a tricks that keeps getting bigger. Is this game complete? No, but the developer(s) are part of this community and are actively trying to fix bugs with the help of us. This game already looks beautiful and is a must have for skiers and boarders alike. Definately get SNOW if you want to see a completed version of this game and support the devs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As of current, SNOW is in Pre-Alpha, and as its being developed by just three people, it'll be like this for a while. SNOW is not flawless, and does have its fair share of bugs. One major flaw is that there is no audio, but one good fix I found is to have some music in the background, something fast paced, as you ski past all these rocks and obstacles that never seem to stop coming. Controls need a little bit of work, and they will arrive in due time.

I honestly reccomend this game to people who like sking/winter sports, or just enjoy crashing their skier into a couple hundred obstacles.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What is this crap?

I bought this long time ago.
Now i try to play again, despite having a bad feeling caused by previous playtime.

And OMG nothings changed, at least not in positive way.
FPS is even lower than before.
I run GTA5 at High settings across surround (triple screen) 5240x1080

But this game even at low settings cant reach stable 60 FPS.

Within a few minutes i was down the hill from the top.
The whole ride was short and not interresting at all.

And what happend below the bottom?
Well i found out that all detail was gone, trees floating above the ground, weird textures glitches from shading happend there, and no guidance to some spot where it would continue or stop the game.
Instead i felt of the edge of the level, no timeout to send me to ground again nothing.

I previously asked steam for a refund on this because i think its a scam.
This game is bad.
Many want it to be good (even me) but as i see it, this will never happen.

This game will be a turd.
And they are trying to make it shine.

I think it will never be optimized, so always bad FPS.
The end of level is a empty zone filled with bugs.

The ragdoll effects are a joke.
The whole animation is a joke...

This game is a money grab.
And they will grab all they can before this company will fanish in history.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start by saying THANK YOU for not creating an SSX.  But...

So far, this game still isn't at par with most simulator type skiing\snowboarding games that have already been on the market.  The character is stiff, weightless, and too obviously procedurally driven.  It looks and feels like you are controlling the skiis not the rider.  The controls are very binary when they should take advantage of modern analog controllers. For instance, regardless if you tap the steering controls or hold, the character drops right into the extremity of the turning poses.  Same for grabs and any other feedback coming from the character.

There is no sense of speed unless you are in the trees. The levels feel wide open, flat, and tricking opportunities are sparse. The jumps in the parks feel dauntingly huge and are seemingly too big for the lack of speed even at max speed.   The physics feel just as binary as the controls and don't work well with the level design metrics for the terrain or park obstacles.  Rails riding is quirky and the rider looks dorky. Halfpipe riding is frustrating and it's nearly impossible to get any speed\air.  The radgoll is just broken, and bailing in any game other than EA Skate isn't fun. It's punishing and wastes a players time.

The best parts of this game are the jump on the right thumbstick (thank you EA Skate) when it works and doesn't give you an awkward emote instead. As well, a huge plus is having the generous ability to customize the ingame camera.

This game has a long way to go before Beta.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Purchased this as it boasted VR Support and showed the Oculas Rift on its webpage. Unfortunatly this is a purchase I very much regret for now.
WHile it looks and plays fine in 2D for an Alpha product, when you enable 3D via the Oculas Rift I found the game unplayable. This is the only time i've found the experience better in 2D than in 3D through the rift.
General complaints are:
Low Framerate (Even when all settings are set to low)
Very Flat 3D" objects. Such as Trees and background. (Looks like a flat picture as the background)
Distancing issue with objects (The moon appears about 4 meters away from your head and closer than other objects)
Very sparse amount of 3D objects so you get a very poor 3D feel.
View disorientating. (If your character is infront of your view. Head tracking does not work correctly) When in "First Person" any character movement affects your view.
Overall I would not recommend this game for use with the Oculas Rift as its a disappointing experience. If this changes
date: im happy to update this review."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So there i was. Fochi 2014 slopestyle. through sweaty fingers, a grimace of pain and a 78th attempt, i was finally flying gracefully off the last hump, tailgrabbing and crossing skis like an eagle. As i landed the almost impossible crossed ski double-rotation tailgrab, i couldnt help feeling like i had just nailed the unnailable.

then i was rocket-blasted of my skis and sent sailing over a stunned crowd, coming to a halt with a broken neck and dislocated limbs as i smacked face-first into the cold, unforgiving ground.

and every second was beautiful.

Every. Second

do your self a favour and come break your limbs with all of us, for the special introductory price of $10!

Snow. Where people break bones. Together.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to start by saying my first impressions were great but as i explored and played more it got worse and worse.

The game has an expansive options menu and a large open world to explore. The game ran great with maxed settings  on my overclocked r9 390 without any stuttering. I was met with my first bug in the tutorial when it asked me to preform a trick and no matter what i did it wouldnt register at all so i quit the tutorial with the basics in mind and set out the open mountains.... except i apperantly scrolled through the drop selection menu too fast and crashed my game so that my screen was covered in black nothingness so i had to reboot my pc. Once i rebooted and scrolled through the drops at a snails pace i got to skiing. It was great doing tricks, flying through the air like a spinning top, crashing and watching the halarious glitched out wipe outs untill after every rock and rewind my character would do weird things like get stuck in t-pose or go down the mountains unable to jump brake or move at some points. My final thoughts are if your just there for the scenery or want to spend real money on ingame skins or clothing and dont mind the sometimes gamebreaking glitches then this is the game for you. But if you want to ski arround without having to troubleshoot some weird bug every few minutes than i would reccomend you get Wii Ski Resort and play that because that is better than this hunk of yellow SNOW.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is really enjoyable and ran smoothly on my pc. High quality textures and a very large draw distance.

I highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoys skiing. This game has a big learning curve but it's really fun and has a very high replay value. (It's really hard to land tricks perfectly) The tutorial is garbage, I didn't learn anything in it and I never passed the third part where you have to land a 720 spinning jump, I don't know the button combinations. The best way is to free-play on the mountain.

There are some bugs but they aren't game breaking. Sometimes I hit something and I crash and on the next run I hit the same object but it just affects my score instead of having me go back.

This game has a lot of potential and is already expanse. I wish that the lifts were operational and you could ride them. I also wish that there was a map because I've gotten lost quite a few times.

TL;DR = Don't buy unless you are a skiing enthusiast, just wait until it’s f2p

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you appreciate skiing/snowboarding?
Do you love games like SSX?
Do you love huge open world games?

Then this game is for you!

SNOW is a great free-to-play game with no features of a pay to win. The only thing you can buy are extra credits which allow you to unlock extra gear (but you get these overtime anyways). The controls are fluid and very refined making it easy to learn but hard to master. There's just nothing like plowing through some fresh powder or hitting a 540 Corkscrew in first person.

Only downside is you basically NEED some sort of controller to play it (mouse and keyboard ain't going to cut it) but they're pretty cheap and easy to find.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to start by saying my first impressions were great but as i explored and played more it got worse and worse.

The game has an expansive options menu and a large open world to explore. The game ran great with maxed settings  on my overclocked r9 390 without any stuttering. I was met with my first bug in the tutorial when it asked me to preform a trick and no matter what i did it wouldnt register at all so i quit the tutorial with the basics in mind and set out the open mountains.... except i apperantly scrolled through the drop selection menu too fast and crashed my game so that my screen was covered in black nothingness so i had to reboot my pc. Once i rebooted and scrolled through the drops at a snails pace i got to skiing. It was great doing tricks, flying through the air like a spinning top, crashing and watching the halarious glitched out wipe outs untill after every rock and rewind my character would do weird things like get stuck in t-pose or go down the mountains unable to jump brake or move at some points. My final thoughts are if your just there for the scenery or want to spend real money on ingame skins or clothing and dont mind the sometimes gamebreaking glitches then this is the game for you. But if you want to ski arround without having to troubleshoot some weird bug every few minutes than i would reccomend you get Wii Ski Resort and play that because that is better than this hunk of yellow SNOW.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIgnore the negative reviews, SNOW is an outstanding skiing game and blows other free-to-play games out of the water. SNOW has everything that makes a good game in one big package. First off the graphics look outstanding, almost as if I'm actually on a mountian. Amazing UI its basic and gets the job done. Multiplayer works and allows you to race with friends and explore the beautiful landscapes this game can offer. I am not a huge fan of skiing and I had a blast, anyone who likes a game that can offer ANY of the above should instantly download SNOW. Its free-to-play but it does not shove its microtransactions in your face. Never while I was playing did I feel forced to buy any credits as the game offers them from regular play. You have nothing to lose by giving this great game a chance and It is a project I will continue to follow and support.
